is extremely highly available one of the Amazon requirements is a database that never goes down that means no planned
outage and no unplanned outage so we achieve that by by dynamo always writes everything into three different
availability zones so there's three copies of all data whatever you do now
that means it's eventually consistent because I write it and one availability sound say okay I'm written and
eventually copied to the other two so whatever you read from dynamo you have two choices you can do a standard read
standard read will just grab the first availability zone it sees or at highly consistent read highly consistent read
will read all three availability zones and give you the newest one so highly consistent read has twice the cost of a
standard read so you can decide which sort of read you want to do when you read the data and that way I can never
go down because whenever we're doing upgrades or other things it can happen rolling across those availability zones
